Steamship Agents and Insurance Brokers. :: :: Freight Contractors and Forwarding Agents. :: :: Wharfingers and Master Porters. :: :: :: :: Motor Carriers and Haulage Contractors. :: :: General Warehouse Keepers and Distributing Agents. REMOVALS. We are in a position to quote an inclusive price for the Removr ' of Household Goods, Baggage or Personal Effects, from or to any part of the World, covering the Hire of necessary Furniture Vans or Cases, Cost of Packing, Freight, Insur- ance, and Delivery at Destination. Long Distance Removals conducted by Motor Furniture Vans when desired. STORAGE. HOUSEHOLD GOODS & BAGGAGE Superior Storage Accommodation for Baggage, Furniture, Musical Instruments, Plate and other Household Goods. Customers can have their own Separate Room in our Warehouse. Parties intending storing their property are invited to inspect our Depository before making arrangements elsewhere. GENERAL MERCHANDISE We have twenty separate Warehouses adapted for the Storage of all classes of Merchandise in order to >£Hsure minimum Insurance Rates and are therefore in a position to und^take^he warehousing and handling of Goods of every description. Special facilities to ensure the safe handling of Machinery, Motor Cars and o»er hedvy Packages. GENERAL SHIPPING. We undertake the Shipping of all classes of Goods, in either Small or Large Consignments from or to any part of the World, and are at the service of Manufacturers, Merchants and Shippers for any assistance they may require with a view to the increase of Export or Import Trade. THROUGH INCLUSIVE FREIGHT RATES ARRANGED COVERING ALL CHARGES. PASSENGERS BOOKED BY ALL THE PRINCIPAL STEAMSHIP LINES. DISTRIBUTING OR WAREHOUSING. Import Shipments Cleared, Forwarded, Distributed, or Stored in our own Warehouses as may be required by Importing Firms. Send us your Endorsed Bill of Lading, together with Disposal instructions, and we shall relieve you of all Customs and other details incidental to the handling of Import Shipments. Wo are TRANSPORT SPECIALISTS and our unique combination of facilities enables us to under- take the handling of all classes of Transport Business on the BEST POSSIBLE TERMS CONSISTENT WITH EFFICIENT SERVICE. Merchants and Shippers will find it to their advantage to entrust their Transport Business to our care. Ship Owners, Ship Brokers, Freight Contractors and Shipping Agents outside of Scotland are invited to allow us to attend to their interests in Scotland. We guarantee such efficient service and attention to instructions as these firms might command from their own office and undertake to co-operate with them and protect their interests in every respect. Telegrams: "TRANSIT, GLASGOW." Telephones: 5 Lines. No. 9395 Central Private Branch Exchange Chief Offices :— 381, ARGYLE STREET. GLAiGOW Also at LONDON, LIVERPOOL and MANCHESTER Established 1900. BRANCH OFFICES : MANCHESTER : 1, ST. JAMES'S SQUARE. SHEFFIELD: 1, HOWARD STRE3T. BIRMINGHAM : US, COLMORE Row. LEEDS: 12, EAST Parade. LIVERPOOL : 10A, SOUTH CASTLE STBEET. NEW YORK : (Kelly Publishing Oo.) 70, Fifth avexue. PARIS: (AGENCY). HAMBURG: (AGENCY). TORONTO: (AGENCY). KOBE (JAPAN): 14, KOBE BUILDING. PRICE SIXTY-FOUR SHILLING! LONDON: KELLY'S DIRECTORIES LTD., PRINTERS 186, STRAND, TV. 0.2 AND MIDDLE MILL, KINGSTON-ON-THAMES. A. PREFACE The Proprietors trust that this— the Sixteenth — Edition of the Directory or Scotland may be found equal in accuracy to the previous issues. Under each County the Parishes, Towns and principal Villages have been arranged in strict Alphabetical order, with a view to facility of reference, and the names of the Magistrates, the Members of the County Councils, the County Officers, &c, have been given. The Cities of Edinburgh and Glasgow, with • a Street Directory in each case, are given separately. In addition to the lists of names given in the " Private Residents " and "Trades and Professional" sections there is also a list of the "Principal Seats " in Scotland. This list gives the names of the occupiers, together with references to the pages in the body of the book on which particulars of the various mansions will be found. Prefixed to the Book is a complete Index to the whole of the places given therein. The 1921 Census returns were published too late to be incorporated in the body of the book. The new figures for the counties and principal towns, however, will be found on page xxxvi. under Statistics for the Country. The Publishers beg to draw attention to the fact that their Glasgow Office is at oo, Glassford Street. October, 1921. .
